radiographic_examinations.findings: Disk protrusions, hypertrophy of the ligamentum flavum, and facet arthropathy resulting in moderate to severe neural foraminal narrowing at the L4–L5 and L5–S1 levels. Thickened and clumped appearance of nerve roots between L3 and S1, with enhancement on contrast-enhanced images.
Subcentimeter pulmonary nodules in the bilateral lower lobes that remained unchanged over a period of 4 years.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No clinically significant change in previously identified pulmonary nodules.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: MRI of the lumbar spine and head
radiographic_examinations.findings: Diffuse, irregular, abnormal hyperintensity in the spinal cord extending from T10 inferiorly to the conus. Marked thickening and enhancement of the nerve roots with severe mass effect on the conus. Abnormal diffuse hyperintensity in the cerebral sulci and patchy ill-defined foci of enhancement in the periventricular white matter on the brain MRI.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Gradual progression of the clumping, thickening, and enhancement of the cauda equina nerve roots.
